Idiom (Bavarian): Da Fisch stinkt vom Kopf her.
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: Problems in an organization start at the top (leadership is responsible).
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Die Führung ist schuld an den Missständen.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Originates from Middle High German; used in politics and journalism.
First Example Sentence: Da Fisch stinkt vom Kopf her, drum wundert mi nix mehr.
Second Example Sentence: Bei uns in da Firma is des aa so – da Fisch stinkt vom Kopf her.
Third Example Sentence: Des sogn’s imma, wenn’s um schlechte Chefs geht.

Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: No complaint means approval (silence implies consent).
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Wenn niemand schimpft, is es eh gut.
First Example Sentence: Da Chef hod nix g’sagt, also passt’s – ned g’schimpft is globt gnua.
Second Example Sentence: Bei uns dahoam sogn’s des, wenn ois ruahig is.
Third Example Sentence: Na, wia i nix hör, dann is ois recht – ned g’schimpft is globt gnua.

Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: The devil is in the details (small things cause big problems).
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Kleine Dinge machen oft große Schwierigkeiten.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: European proverb adapted to Bavarian speech.
First Example Sentence: Pass auf, da Deifi steckt im Detail, wennst des baust.
Second Example Sentence: Bei da Planung muass ma g’nau sei – da Deifi steckt im Detail.
Third Example Sentence: Mir ham uns wieder valoffn – da Deifi steckt im Detail.

Idiom (Bavarian): Da is Hopfen und Malz verloren.
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: All hope is lost; it’s hopeless.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Originates from brewing culture; refers to spoiled beer.
First Example Sentence: Bei dem Schüler is Hopfen und Malz verloren.
Second Example Sentence: Da Computer geht nimma – Hopfen und Malz verloren.
Third Example Sentence: Na, bei dem Fall hilft nix mehr – Hopfen und Malz verloren.

Idiom (Bavarian): Da ko da Hund drin vagraffa sei.
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: It’s a real mess; chaotic situation.
Cultural Origin or Historical Reference: Likely derived from rural speech; used in domestic contexts.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Bavarian): [da kɔ da hʊnt drɪn faˈɡʁafɐ zaɪ̯]
First Example Sentence: In dera Wohnung ko da Hund drin vagraffa sei!
Second Example Sentence: Na schau, wia des ausschaut – do ko da Hund drin vagraffa sei.
Third Example Sentence: Da Keller is so unaufgräumt, da ko da Hund drin vagraffa sei.

Idiom (Bavarian): Da Gschmeidige kommt weida wia da Stiara.
Figurative Meaning (Contextualized Defin: A flexible person succeeds more than a stubborn one.
Non-Idiomatic Equivalent (Plain, Neutral: Wer flexibel ist, erreicht mehr als ein Starrkopf.
Phonetic Transcription (IPA, Bavarian): [da ɡʃmaɪ̯dɪɡə kɔmt vaɪ̯da viː da ʃtiːɐ̯a]
First Example Sentence: Bleib locker, da Gschmeidige kommt weida wia da Stiara.
Second Example Sentence: Des hob i vo mei’m Opa g’lernt – da Gschmeidige kommt weida wia da Stiara.
Third Example Sentence: Im Leben muaß ma biegsam sei, weil da Gschmeidige kommt weida wia da Stiara.
